element.BriefDescription: Zirconium is a lustrous, grey-white, strong transition metal that resembles hafnium and, to a lesser extent, titanium. Zirconium is mainly used as a refractory (material that retains its strength at high temperatues) and opacifier (a substance added to a material in order to make the ensuing system opaque), although it is used in small amounts as an alloying agent for its strong resistance to corrosion.
